snippet: In an unmistakable message to Beijing, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton told democracy advocates that economic success without political reform was unsustainable.
abstract: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, in an unmistakable message to China, says in a speech from Mongolia that economic success without meaningful political openness is an unsustainable equation that would ultimately lead to instability; she is visiting Mongolia on the second day of an Asia tour dedicated to broadening the Obama administration’s renewed focus on the region.
lead_paragraph: In an unmistakable message to Beijing, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton told democracy advocates that economic success without political reform was unsustainable.

headline.seo: From Mongolia, Clinton Takes a Jab at Neighboring China
headline.main: From Mongolia, Clinton Takes a Jab at China
headline.print_headline: From Mongolia, Clinton Takes Jab at China

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
